ygData.subject: RE: Sol hunting
ygData.msgSnippet: Sol A entrance is bugged.  Weeks ago me went with some guys and we managed to zone in.  Last week I went with Fes/FF/Febon but this time when we try to zone
ygData.messageBody:
Sol A entrance is bugged. Weeks ago me went with some guys and we managed
to zone in. Last week I went with Fes/FF/Febon but this time when we try
to zone in, it teleport us to somewhere in Lava. Fes said Sol A mob are
deeper (refer to those tat give us xp), while Sol B mob (blue) are closing
to zone, so in a sense safer.

Asking wiz below 40 to standby for eva means he can't nuke much. Eva,
thou' take shorter casting time than portal spells, still take longer than
nornal gate spells and can easily disturbed. The only situation I can
think of eva been useful is when the team has at least 1-2 tanks and wiz
only nuke after mob's HP drop to below 50%, meaning wiz's nuking will NOT
taunt mob to him/her (wiz heavy nuking outshine all tanks' taunt, and u
tanks should be ashame of yaself, hehe). H/w, most of the time wiz need to
eva is when a train is activated, and chances it that wiz will have already
nuke some mobs and draw them to him/her. Of coz, wiz can always standby
all time to eva (ie once trains come, eva), but it will be very boring.
Worst scenerio I can think of, is when wiz fizzy until he dun have enuff
mana to eva and he gate out instead, meaning those tanks who cannot gate
out is left to rot, hehe.

One thing for sure, no casters will wanna team with those cowboys (ie those
pple who are impatient most of the time and wanna chiong all the way, w/o
giving warning msg to those casters who are oom and med). For this type of
team-mate, I will be the 1st one who gate out - since u never bother abt my
survival, why shld I? ;) So if there is any cowboy in this ML, pls ponder
abit b4 you complain why no casters wanna team with u.

Anyway, my saliver already start dropping with so many goodies in Sol A.
If we can get 1 or 2 tank, I sure go, since we already got nukers and
healer , heh.

Ziltus



On Monday, 20 September, 1999 6:28 PM, Gary Qui Hong Loong
[SMTP:kanglun@...] wrote:
> From: Gary Qui Hong Loong <kanglun@...>
>
> U know where is Najena rite? It's on the rite hand side of Lavamnt when
> u zone in from the DE newbie hunting grounds. U turn left instead. Then
> go until u reach the merchant at the druid stone. then from there head
> north and East abit. When u c a goblin camp u're close alreadi. Sol A
> and Sol B entrance is close to each other. Valadine has been to Sol A.
> He can bring u there if needed. Btw, go Sol A if u can. They give alot
> of good stuff. I can agag bring u ppl around but make sure for a druid
> or Wizzie to gate out hor, b'cos there are sooo many secret walls and
> stuff. There are certain places I can bring u to b'cos it's close to the
> zone, eg the Foreman Tunic spawn. The goblin capt one is harder b'cos is
> deeper and alot of greenie goblins too. It gives the Charred Plate Armor
> (Boots and Gloves). Then there is the EXG clockwork (chicken Feed to win
> but it hits hard. But me (at lvl 40) and a 34th Ranger just bash it to
> death without healing. U just need to make sure u kill it away from the
> bridge so that the gnomes don't help it. EXG gives the Charred Plate
> Armor or The Charred Guardian Shield (plus 9 Wis). And at the gnome
> castle there is the Dibble (?) give the molten cloak (plus 4 int and
> wis). And then there is the little imp called Flint(??). It gives the
> imp skin gloves (plus 5int (??)). Then there is a small little drake
> called Singe (??). It gives Drakescale Belt (forgot stats alreadi) but
> give some dex and agi? or it gives the earring that gives mana and plus
> 4int. And then there is the Goblin King that gives a good ring (plus
> 4int and 4 Str) and the Scepter that gives wis?.
>
>
> LKW wrote:
> >
> > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> >
> > Hmm, for those who stuck at 30s like me, maybe we have to start grping
in

give

> >
> > Anyone got loc of Sol B pls post in ML, thx.

[SMTP:garford@...]

hell,

there......

can

too.

serrated
> > bone dirk,
> > > > >

> > > > > described as a Dark Elf, I asked him what was up.
> > > > >
> > > > > He told me he had a mask that would cast Illusion: Dark Elf when
> > > > > activated. (The mechanism is the same as the fabled Journeyman
> > > > > boots.) He may not have been wearing it, but he definitely could
> > > > > use it.
